column4: can someone help me on this: i filling the /etc/exports file for NFS, i typed "/home 192.168.0.1(rw)" and when i "sudo exportfs -ra" it says "/home:invalid argument" , what's happening?
where can i find the server type i don't see it in /etc/init.d ?
i see NFS but not the type
you have to install nfs-<server> to be able to export your home
ok there are two nfs common and nfs kernel do i restart both?
try starting the kernel server... it's faster and stable. then check exportfs
or the dhcp server config... to suggest that you like a particular ip... fixed ip
printing is *hell* to config in linux
yesterday the printer worked fine, but my ip changed today so it doesn't anymore, funny stuff
